byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Hildale, and Richard Pérez-Peña and Christine Hauser from New York. Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By IAN LOVETT, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and CHRISTINE HAUSER

abstract: Flash floods in Utah kill at least 16 people, sweeping away cars and hikers; 12 victims, who were members of Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, were on family outing.
lead_paragraph: At least 16 people died, 12 of them women and children, after flash floods ripped through the state on Monday. Four others were still missing a day later.

headline.main: Flash Floods Roar Through Utah, Sweeping Up Cars and Hikers
headline.print_headline: Flash Floods Roar Through Utah, Sweeping Up Cars and Hikers

snippet: At least 16 people died, 12 of them women and children, after flash floods ripped through the state on Monday. Four others were still missing a day later.
